history.content:
Upper div math courses definitely count as technicals. You won't be allowed to switch to P/NP — if you do, you'll get an email from ESS and they'll switch it back to letter grade. Automatically.

The only way to take a math class for a non-letter grade is (1) if you're auditing the course or (2) if you're in your graduating semester and you do not need the course for your unit requirements.

I'm an EECS major currently taking an upper division math course, and would like to switch it to P/NP if possible. I'm aware that the 45 upper division engineering units requirement for EECS must be taken for a letter grade. Does math count as "engineering" or "technical"? What exactly are "technical" vs. "engineering" courses? Will taking this course P/NP rather than for a letter grade affect any of my graduation requirements besides my total unit requirement?

Thanks!
history.subject: Switching math class to P/NP
